title.narrative: Local Employment in Africa for Development phase II (LEAD)

description.narrative: Outcome 1: Strengthened institutional capacity of local partner organisations and government agencies to support SME development, employment and creation of enabling business environment. Outcome 2: Jobs are created for youth, with a focus on women, through SME creation and growth Outcome 3: Young people, especially young women, have the necessary and relevant skills and preparation to enter the job market and find jobs

The local Employment in Africa for Development is a job creation program that seeks to foster a culture of entrepreneurship among youth in Tunisia, and in Somalia/land. Through the development of business ideas, the provision of training and coaching, and supporting access to finance, the LEAD program aims to prevent economic migration and encourage youth to establish domestic enterprises.
The main target group for the project is youth in the age range 18 to 35

participating-org.narrative: Association de Développement Durable et de Coopération Internationale

title.narrative: Lead 2020 Annual Report

description.narrative: A stipend is a predetermined amount of money that's paid to vulnerable youth who have participated in SPARK or its local partners offered training, internship in order to help offset expenses.

title.narrative: Number bankable business plans created

description.narrative: Business plan BP is a document developed by the entrepreneur to outline the SME to be created and to be submitted to a bank/MFI in order to assist in the business creation step. It should include the following topics: Executive summary of the business plan/ the product,services/ market overview/ marketing and sales/ company structure / success and risk factors/ financial plan and investment plan. A bankable BP is as BP which high probability of getting funded by banks or MFIs, as declared by experts/consultants, BDS providers or banks and MFIs staff

title.narrative: Number bankable business plans created

description.narrative: Business plan BP is a document developed by the entrepreneur to outline the SME to be created and to be submitted to a bank/MFI in order to assist in the business creation step. It should include the following topics: Executive summary of the business plan/ the product,services/ market overview/ marketing and sales/ company structure / success and risk factors/ financial plan and investment plan. A bankable BP is as BP which high probability of getting funded by banks or MFIs, as declared by experts/consultants, BDS providers or banks and MFIs staff

title.narrative: Number of youth placed in jobs

description.narrative: Formal Employment: SPARK beneficiaries who acquire a formal job (i.e. sign an employment contract), after receiving SPARK’s support (e.g. employability training). Informal Employment: SPARK beneficiaries who acquire a job in the formal or informal sector, but do not have a regular employment contract, after receiving SPARK’s support (e.g. employability training). Formal job in formal business: Work position, formalised by an employment contract, which has a minimum duration of 6 months and is created in a formal business, which is a start-up or an existing business that grew (and thereby is able to employ more people). Informal job in formal business: Work position, not formalised by an employment contract, has a minimum duration of 6 months and is created in a formal business. The formal business can be a start-up or an existing business that grew (and thereby is able to employ more people). Informal job in informal business: Work position, not formalised by an employment contract, has a minimum duration of 6 months and is created in an informal business. The informal business can be a start-up or an existing business that grew (and thereby is able to employ more people).

title.narrative: Number of loans and grants facilitated for entrepreneurs

description.narrative: SPARK beneficiaries who received a financial services (e.g. loan, grant, etc.) directly by SPARK or by third party (after SPARK's facilitation/support for this).

title.narrative: Number of loans and grants facilitated for entrepreneurs

description.narrative: SPARK beneficiaries who received a financial services (e.g. loan, grant, etc.) directly by SPARK or by third party (after SPARK's facilitation/support for this).

title.narrative: Strengthening local partners

description.narrative: Strengthening local partners through business/career centres improved and/or strengthened, TVET centres strengthened, BDS providers supported and online platforms created

title.narrative: Number of BDS providers supported

description.narrative: BDS providers are public or private entities that offer a wide range of services to MSMEs including consultancy, training, mentoring, marketing support, technology know-how, policy advocacy, infrastructure and access to finance

comment.narrative: Due to the prolonged recruitment processes in this period the programme implementation was paused.

title.narrative: Number of business/career centres improved and/or strengthened

description.narrative: Business centres: A physical space that provides business-related assistance and knowledge to help new entrepreneurs start, run, and grow their business, and also provides information, training, legal advice, referral and technical assistance to existing businesses. Career centres: A physical space that provides assistance to students with honing their job search skills, identifying and working toward career goals and finding suitable careers. Career centre can be affiliated to public or private universities.

title.narrative: Number of online platforms created

description.narrative: Online platform is a specially developed platform (website, or a phone application) using Internet technology for the design and development of a wide range of services for the benefit of entrepreneurs

title.narrative: Number of TVET centres strengthened

description.narrative: TVET (Technical and Vocational Education and Training) centre is a physical space that provides education and training in the purpose of preparing youth for work. It can also support self-employment by supporting entrepreneurship training

title.narrative: Number of teachers trained

description.narrative: Teachers are TVETs or public education institutions teachers - who were trained by SPARK or its local partners.

comment.narrative: Due to the prolonged recruitment processes in this period the programme implementation was paused.

title.narrative: Number of SMEs started

description.narrative: "Formal business: economic activity generating revenues for the owner in various sector (trade, services, industry, tourism, etc ...) and formally registered according to the country’s legislation, which did not exist before the program intervention and that the program activities contributed to its establishment Informal business:economic activity generating revenues for the owner in various sector (trade, services, industry, tourism, etc ...) and not formally registered according to the country’s legislation which did not exist before the program intervention and that the program activities contributed to its establishment"
